    public class TimeSlider
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
    Widget for visualizing time enabled layers.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

      • TimeSlider

        public TimeSlider(TimeSlider.Parameters params,
          DijitLoadHandler handler)
        Creates a new TimeSlider object.
        Parameters:
        params - - Parameters for the time slider object.
        loadHandler - - handler to fire when dijit is created. All method calls will fail untill this event fires.

        public void createTimeStopsByCount(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        The specified number of time stops are created for the input time extent.
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - The time extent used to define the time slider's start and end time stops.

      • createTimeStopsByCount

        public void createTimeStopsByCount(TimeExtent timeExtent,
                          int count)
        The specified number of time stops are created for the input time extent.
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - The time extent used to define the time slider's start and end time stops.
        count - - The number of time stops to create.

      • createTimeStopsByTimeInterval

        public void createTimeStopsByTimeInterval(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        Create a time stop for each interval specified, i.e.(week,month, day).
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - The time extent used to define the time slider's start and end time stops.

      • createTimeStopsByTimeInterval

        public void createTimeStopsByTimeInterval(TimeExtent timeExtent,
                                 int timeInterval,
                                 TimeInfo.TimeUnits timeIntervalUnits)
        Create a time stop for each interval specified, i.e.(week,month, day).
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - The time extent used to define the time slider's start and end time stops.
        timeInterval - - The length of the time interval.
        timeIntervalUnits - - Time units.

      • setLabels

        public void setLabels(java.lang.String[] labels)
        Specify an array of strings to be used as labels. The array position for each string defines which tick it will be placed on.
        Parameters:
        labels - - An array of strings that define the labels for each tick.

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Determines whether or not loop. Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        loop - - True plays the time slider continuously. Default value is false.

      • setThumbCount

        public void setThumbCount(int thumbCount)
        The number of thumbs to display. A value of one displays a single thumb. Setting the value to 2 displays a range slider.
        Parameters:
        thumbCount - - The number of thumbs to display. Default value is one.

      • setThumbIndexes

        public void setThumbIndexes(int first,
                   int second)
        Parameters:
        first - - determinds where to put the first thumb.
        second - - If it is a two thumb slider the second value determines where to place the additional thumb.

      • setThumbMovingRate

        public void setThumbMovingRate(int thumbMovingRate)
        Change the rate at which the time animation plays.
        Parameters:
        thumbMovingRate - - The rate at which the time slider plays. Default value is 1500.

      • setTickCount

        public void setTickCount(int tickCount)
        Specify the number of ticks to display on the time slider.
        Parameters:
        tickCount - - The number of ticks to display on the slider.

      • setTimeStops

        public void setTimeStops(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsDate[] stops)
        Manually define the time stop locations by providing an array of dates.
        Parameters:
        stops - - Array of dates

      • singleThumbAsTimeInstant

        public void singleThumbAsTimeInstant(boolean createTimeInstants)
        Determine if the time is displayed for an instant in time. Only valid when the thumb count is set to one.
        Parameters:
        createTimeInstants - - When true, the time slider displays features for the current point in time. When false cumulative data is displayed from the start time to the current thumb location. The default value is false.

      • startup

        public void startup()
        This is not in the docs but in the examples. Required to start the dijit. Seems to error so I have wrapped it up till the bug is figured out.

      • addTimeExtentChangeHandler

        public final void addTimeExtentChangeHandler(TimeExtentChangeHandler handler)
        Add time extent changed handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - - Fires when the timeExtent of the TimeSlider is changed.
